result.execSummary:
The defendant Westley D Jackson III was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Firearm-Convicted of a Felony, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court ordered the defendant to provide a DNA sample.  Court ordered the defendant to pay a fine of $1,500.00 with a payment plan of $100/month until paid in full.  Court further ordered the defendant to pay all mandatory court costs, fees, fine, and surcharges (including DNA) with a payment plan of $100/month until paid in full.  Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment.
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon, he may never own or possess a firearm. Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Westley D Jackson III

defendant.name: Jackson, Westley D, III

records.addlTxt: See CCAP Financial Payment Plan application for specific monthly due dates for this UTPPP case # 2022CF000290.

Defendant Westley D Jackson III in court.  Attorney Paul A. Ksicinski Mr. in court for Westley D Jackson III.  Attorney Alexander James Geocaris in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for plea/sentencing.  Parties have reached an agreement.  Plea negotiations set forth on the record and agreed upon by the parties.

AS TO COUNT 1:
Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Pursuant to plea negotiations and on the motion of the State, Court ordered COUNT 2 DISMISSED BUT READ IN for the purpose of sentencing.  

Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon, he may never own or possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  Sentencing proceeded.

...
Statements made by State, Defense, and Defendant.

Court ordered the defendant to provide a DNA sample.  Court ordered the defendant to pay a fine of $1,500.00 with a payment plan of $100/month until paid in full.  Court further ordered the defendant to pay all mandatory court costs, fees, fine, and surcharges (including DNA) with a payment plan of $100/month until paid in full.  Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment.  

20 day Appeal rights given.
Received and Filed: Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum
Received and Filed: POSSESSION OF A FIREARM
Received and Filed- RESISTING AN OFFICER
Received and Filed: Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Westley D Jackson in court with attorney Paul A. Ksicinski who appeared by zoom because he is unable to pass the Milwaukee County health protocol screening..  Alexander James Geocaris appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 25.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 25, 2022 at 01:31 pm.

OFF THE RECORD: 
Defendant Westley D Jackson in court with attorney Paul A. Ksicinski.  Alexander James Geocaris appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Status conference held. Court in trial on another matter. Defense requests plea date.  Plea hearing scheduled for July 19, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Received and Filed. defense atty request to appear electronically at status

Defendant Westley D Jackson in court with Attorney Paul A. Ksicinski.  Dennis Murphy for Alexander Geocaris appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for indigency hearing, the defendant has hired private counsel.    Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial. Defense acknowledges receipt of the Information, waives reading and enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of his client.  Defense is requesting a Status Conference date. The Court Order the matter adjourned back to Branch 28.  Status conference scheduled for May 10, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Amount: $20.00

Defendant Westley D Jackson in court.  Matthew Zisi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is not present. Defendant appears without counsel.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Sanders, Branch 28.   Court orders the case adjourned for CAUSE for an Indigency Hearing.  Indigency hearing scheduled for March 4, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered no possession or use of any dangerous weapons or firearms.
DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON 02/11/2022. IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Defendant Westley D Jackson in court with attorney Rosemary Cuevas.  Allysa Bria Brown appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Sanders, Branch 28.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  Defense did not put a plea in as to Count 2. DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 2/9/22 @ 1p
